About.paragraph: MN WE: Wish to Empower is a nonprofit dedicated to transforming the lives of those in underdeveloped countries by fundraising to provide them with access to education and resources. We are formerly known as WE Charity - MN.
Why: Our mission is to put on events for students at the University of Minnesota who are passionate about making a change and have them hands-on make a positive impact both locally and internationally. We want to raise awareness not only about issues that people face around the world like limited access education and clean water, but also issues that are faced by those in our own community like racial injustice.

Features.title: Awareness
Features.text: By being aware of issues that are faced both locally and internationally, we are able to understand what is going on in the community and help those affected.

Features.title: Resources
Features.text: The resources pillar provides resources, like aid for COVID-19 relief and humanitarian aid, through our fundraising efforts.

Features.title: Education
Features.text: The education pillar focuses on educating the local community about issues that are faced by minorities and what can be done to help them.

Events.title: We teamed up with the Al-Madinah Cultural Center for a discussion on "Racial Disparities: Effects of Covid on the BIPOC Community"

Over the Summer of 2020, we hosted series of zoom discussions regarding racial injustice. Each week we had guest speakers discuss various topics related to the Civil Rights Movement, Black Lives Matter, and racism.
We raised $434 for the North Anoka County Emergency Food Shelf to provide food for families with school-aged children in the Twin Cities!
WE Walk for Health was a virtual walkathon in which we were able to raise $350 for PATH, which helps provide COVID testing support, research, and relief globally.
We raised $1657 for the Islamic Relief for humanitarian aid in Yemen!
We raised over $500! We are now able to provide funding for COVID-19 relief and help build a school in Barind, India!
